metadata.title: CVE-2019-19746 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
make_arrow in arrow.c in Xfig fig2dev 3.2.7b allows a segmentation faultand out-of-bounds write because of an integer overflow via a large arrowtype.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19746` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

fig2dev - 1:3.2.7b-3ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: fig2dev package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:3.2.7b-3ubuntu1').
